This is a testing session, firing 5 interrupts via concurrent random patterns:
1. millis         1000/sec
2. INT0 external 
3. INT1 external 
4. INT2 external 
5. INT3 external

The total number of interrupt (rising edge) events generated is ~25 million for each INT0-3.
Worst case there are 5 interrupts firing in the same time.
The Generator used is the BluePill with "interrupts_pattern_generator3.ino" sketch.
My J1 CPU clock frequency is 23.96MHz (the internal oscillator).

The number of INT0-3 interrupt events processed shall match the sketch output.

Sketch:

START in 10secs..
Generating 100 million 4bit patterns..
END.. 24999042 24996164 24999905 25000560

Forth:

Mecrisp-Ice 1.2

5 load
23960. timer1  ok.
250 prtcounters
0   0 0 0 0
2007   0 0 0 0
4315   31439 31552 31653 31644
7693   175280 175627 175199 175433
11075   319304 319825 319125 319600
14453   462978 463636 462707 463600
..
284939   11983953 11979114 11980613 11983531
288319   12127642 12122798 12124548 12127594
291699   12271530 12266573 12268443 12271458
295082   12415304 12410677 12412681 12415839
298464   12559152 12554587 12556747 12559985
301845   12703398 12698696 12700442 12703785
305226   12847342 12842540 12844388 12847719
..
